bwwExcerpt: New Yorkers have become so wary of offending people that we're afraid to acknowledge our differences, Colin Quinn argues in "The New York Story," a sage and snappy stand-up outing now on the boards at the Cherry Lane Theatre...Performing on a stage gussied up to look like the stoop of a brownstone, Quinn...satirically riffs his way through the history of the city's settlers beginning with the Dutch...Jews, Germans, Puerto Ricans and more come up for examination, but "The New York Story" is no st
